definition: to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
to forget/to overlook/to neglect
favor/grace/kindness
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
justice/righteousness/meaning/foster (father etc)/adopted/artificial (tooth, limb etc)/relationship/friendship
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: I will never make friends with such an ingrate again.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不跟像這樣忘恩負義的人做朋友了。

sentences.english: He upbraided her with her ingratitude.
His ingratitude cut me to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 他的忘恩負義傷透了我的心。

sentences.english: Fagin had told O liver how ungrateful he had been to run away.
sentences.chinese: 費金已告訴他，逃跑是件忘恩負義的事。

sentences.english: Power takes as ingratitude the writhings of its victims .
sentences.chinese: 勢力以爲犧牲者的痛苦是忘恩負義。

sentences.english: Kick the ingrate out of the country.
sentences.chinese: 把這個忘恩負義的混蛋踢出我們的國家。

sentences.english: The goatherd caught up with him and blamed his ungracious behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人追上野山羊，責怪它忘恩負義。

sentences.english: There would be no cycles save for the never-ending cycle of ingratitude.
sentences.chinese: 從此除了忘恩負義的無休止循環將不再有其他循環了。

sentences.english: It's her ingratitude that grates on me.
sentences.chinese: 是她忘恩負義把我惹火了。

sentences.english: Ingratitude is the essence of vileness.
sentences.chinese: 忘恩負義是卑劣的本質。

sentences.english: The old man upbraided him with ingratitude .
sentences.chinese: 那位老人斥責他忘恩負義。

sentences.english: Verily, he is not indignant at their modes of consolation and ingratitude.
sentences.chinese: 其實，他並不氣惱他們自我安慰和忘恩負義的模式。

sentences.english: Cece: Your sister was rebellious and ungrateful for my love, and look where she ended up.
sentences.chinese: 你姐姐忘恩負義，對我的愛叛逆，看看她的結局。

definition: traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to boast shamelessly/to talk big
worse than a dog or pig/lower than low
crafty/slippery/slyboots
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to bear grudges
debt of gratitude
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
shameless
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
